page.title: 14LANDSCAPE
page.content: The fishers'thatched cottages of Lower Clachnaharry have been restored and slated.Retired people live there mostly,only two of them original inhabitants.Mr.Macdonald,aged 81,lives near the older school with the diamond paned windows.His father went there only when he could afford a penny and a piece of wood,coal or peat.The High Street School too is closed.The children go to Muirtown School now.The Post Office and the railway station have gone,but the pretty iron footbridge has been preserved.There are no High St.shops,only Macleod's caravan sales and the Inn.Next to the Canal Office,Clachnarry House is now a boarding house.Only the base of the Battle of Clachnaharry Monument on the old Watch Stone remains.Above,the lower slopes of Craig Phadraig are covered with modern bungalows.
